Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the POIMS Trial?
A) The POIMS Trial is a standard treatment program for early-stage NSCLC.
B) The POIMS Trial is a research study investigating the effects of pre-operative radiation on the immune response in early-stage NSCLC.
C) The POIMS Trial is a commercially available service for improving surgical outcomes in lung cancer.
D) The POIMS Trial is a routine surgical procedure for non-small cell lung cancer without any research components.

Correct answer: B) The POIMS Trial is a research study investigating the effects of pre-operative radiation on the immune response in early-stage NSCLC.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the POIMS Trial research study?
A) To test a new surgical technique for non-small cell lung cancer; B) To evaluate the effects of pre-operative radiation on the immune response in early stage non-small cell lung cancer; C) To compare different chemotherapy regimens; D) To assess the long-term survival rates of advanced lung cancer patients

Correct answer: B) To evaluate the effects of pre-operative radiation on the immune response in early stage non-small cell lung cancer

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
For how long will participants be actively involved in the POIMS Trial study, including follow-up after surgery?
A) Up to 1 year; B) Up to 2 years; C) Up to 5 years; D) Up to 6 months
Correct answer: C) Up to 5 years

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding potential costs to you for participating in the POIMS Trial?
A) You will be responsible for all medical costs associated with the study, including standard care and research-related treatments.
B) The study will cover all costs, including your standard medical care and any additional tests or procedures required for research purposes.
C) You may be responsible for normal co-pays, deductibles, and non-covered services that are not the responsibility of the study, and some procedures may require pre-authorization from your insurance company.
D) You will receive a stipend that will cover all medical and personal expenses incurred during the study period.

Correct answer: C) You may be responsible for normal co-pays, deductibles, and non-covered services that are not the responsibility of the study, and some procedures may require pre-authorization from your insurance company.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What is the correct sequence of procedures that a participant will undergo in the POIMS Trial for early stage NSCLC?

A) Screening, Radiation Treatment, Surgery, Follow-up Visits  
B) Surgery, Radiation Treatment, Follow-up Visits, Screening  
C) Radiation Treatment, Screening, Surgery, Follow-up Visits  
D) Screening, Surgery, Radiation Treatment, Follow-up Visits  

Correct answer: A) Screening, Radiation Treatment, Surgery, Follow-up Visits

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the POIMS Trial at any time?
A) You will be required to reimburse the cost of the study treatments you have received; B) You will no longer be eligible for any medical treatment at the University of Kansas Medical Center; C) Your decision to withdraw will not affect your future care at KUMC; D) You will have to provide a valid reason for your withdrawal to the research team.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following procedures is considered experimental in the POIMS Trial for patients with early-stage non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)?
A) Standard surgical removal of the tumor; B) Pre-operative radiation treatment (SBRT) followed by surgery; C) Routine blood draws for standard medical care; D) Follow-up visits or telephone calls every 3-6 months for health checks

Correct answer: B

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the POIMS Trial at the University of Kansas Medical Center?
A) 5; B) 10; C) 15; D) 20
Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk associated with participating in the POIMS Trial for patients with early-stage NSCLC?
A) Increased risk of common cold; B) Wound healing problems and longer post-operative recovery; C) Immediate cure of the lung cancer; D) Reduced need for surgery

Correct answer: B) Wound healing problems and longer post-operative recovery

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit to the subject for participating in the POIMS Trial?
A) Guaranteed cure of non-small cell lung cancer
B) Immediate financial gain from future commercial products
C) Possible decrease in cancer recurrence due to immune system activation
D) Assurance of no post-operative complications

Correct answer: C) Possible decrease in cancer recurrence due to immune system activation

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What are the alternative treatment options available if you choose not to participate in the POIMS Trial for early stage NSCLC?
A) You can opt for a combination of chemotherapy and radiation without surgery; B) You can receive routine treatment that is already available or consider another research study; C) You will be required to undergo an experimental drug trial; D) No alternative treatments are available outside of the POIMS Trial.

Correct answer: B

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your confidentiality and privacy will be protected if you participate in the POIMS Trial study?
A) Your identity will be shared publicly along with the study results.
B) Your study information will be labeled with a research ID number to protect your identity, and only the research team will have access to the list that matches your name to the research ID number.
C) The research team is not required to keep your identity confidential.
D) Your private health information will be shared with the general public for educational purposes.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a result of participating in the POIMS Trial, what kind of treatment will be provided and who will be responsible for the costs?

A) Treatment will be provided at no charge, and all costs will be covered by the study.
B) Treatment will be provided, but you will be responsible for the usual charges, and claims will be submitted to your insurance.
C) Only emergency treatment will be provided, and you will be responsible for all associated costs.
D) No treatment will be provided for injuries related to the study participation.

Correct answer: B) Treatment will be provided, but you will be responsible for the usual charges, and claims will be submitted to your insurance.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What will happen if you decide not to participate in the POIMS Trial or if you choose to withdraw from the study at any point?

A) You will lose access to certain medical treatments that are only available to study participants.
B) You will face penalties or a reduction in your standard medical benefits.
C) You will continue to receive your usual medical care and will not face any penalties or loss of benefits.
D) Your decision will result in a delay in receiving any medical care.

Correct answer: C) You will continue to receive your usual medical care and will not face any penalties or loss of benefits.
